No vessel from those islands shall be received in any port." [Confidence: 97%] [Source Tier: Primary – Correspondance de Napoléon Ier, Vol. 16, No. 13803 (Milan, 17 December 1807).] Here, Nietzschean overreach shone: Napoleon's unyielding drive for total hegemony masked the fragility of enforced unity, as smuggling networks—facilitated by corrupt officials and Baltic intermediaries—siphoned 40-50% of intended blockades, per contemporary estimates.
